name: Blessings
description: Blessings provides financial assistance to young, single, pregnant women for daycare and scholastic accountability so they can graduate from high school. They are connected with a Christian mentor and participate in life skills and parenting classes and are required to attend a Christ-centered church weekly.

options.name: Graduation
options.details: Attend the annual graduation ceremony and celebration for the girls who have completed their high school degree. Details available in February.

options.name: Annual Walk/Bike Event
options.details: Walk or bike to support Blessings at their annual fundraiser at Stow-Munroe Falls High School Sat., May 13 from 10 a.m. – noon. More details available in April.

name: Broken Chains
description: Broken Chains Ministry is a faith-based, non-profit headquartered in the Summit County Jail in Akron. The mission is to engage former offenders for the purpose of reintegration back into the community, thereby lowering recidivism rates in Akron and increasing public safety. Introducing these former offenders to Jesus Christ is the primary and most important thing this ministry works to accomplish.

name: Faithful Servants
description: Faithful Servants is a Christian-based health care organization committed to providing urgent care to the uninsured with an income below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level in the greater Akron area. Services are provided at no cost to the patient by professional, licensed physicians and clinicians who volunteer their time and talents to serve those in need.

options.name: Volunteers’ Meal

name: First Glance
description: First Glance is a student center in the Kenmore community of Akron that is open most evenings of the week with the mission of connecting students to Christ and the church through real, loving and non-threating avenues.

description: Haven of Rest provides Christ-centered programs and services that respond to the physical, spiritual and emotional needs of homeless and poor men, women and children in the Akron area.

name: Legacies of Success
description: Legacies of Success (LOS) exists to revitalize the North Hill community by transforming the neighborhood one house at a time. LOS efforts are invested in improving the lives of the current residents and helping them to benefit from the improvements in the neighborhood. Changing the lives of the current residents and introducing them to Christ is the top priority.

name: Mobility Worldwide
description: Mobility Worldwide is a faith-based, volunteer-driven non-profit that manufactures and distributes mobility carts so that recipients may “in the name of Jesus Christ, arise and walk.” (Acts 3:6)

name: Pregnancy Solutions & Services
description: The Pregnancy Solutions and Services (PSS) ultra-sound van travels to shopping areas, clinics, inner-city and rural locations providing a safe, clean environment where a registered sonographer reveals the clients' options and ties them to the truth of the gospel. PSS is committed to training prospective parents how to care for their babies and provides items they will need for the child's physical needs.

name: Rahab
description: Rahab is a non-profit Christian ministry of volunteers devoted to rescuing and restoring women who are trafficked into prostitution in Northeast Ohio.

options.name: Visit Rahab House
options.details: Visit the Rahab House during weekly programming (varying hours, Mon. – Fri. between 10 a.m. - 5 p.m.). There's availability for two-four men, women and children each day. One week's notice requested. Email Leann to schedule your visit.

name: South Street Ministries
description: South Street Ministries was founded and modeled after the philosophies of the Christian Community Development Association (CCDA). The backbone of the CCDA's ministry philosophy is the three R's: relocation, racial reconciliation and redistribution. Work includes jail, youth, women's ministries, after-school programs, bike shops, an urban garden and other community outreaches.

name: True North
description: Every year, True North Ministry reaches more than 2,200 imprisoned youth with Christ-centered programming via 130 volunteer missionaries. The mission of this ministry, “to liberate imprisoned youth,” permeates all aspects of the organization and reflects the youth they serve.

options.name: Visit the Farm
options.details: Visit six young men working on the farm Mon., Wed., Thu. and Fri. from 10 a.m. - 4 p.m. and bring them lunch. Email Dave or call 330.896.2700 to plan your visit.

options.details: Visit the farm and get to know True North's ministry opportunities one Saturday this fall. More details to come.

name: Truly Reaching You
description: Truly Reaching You Ministries (TRY) is a relationship-based reentry organization that reaches out to men and women who have served their sentence and are returning to their communities. Through relationships, mentorships, training and education, TRY provides a healthy support system for those who have made the commitment to surrender their old lifestyle. Pointing the men and women to Christ is the number one priority for this ministry.

description: Urban Vision reaches the North Akron Community by demonstrating the redemptive love of Jesus Christ through Christ-centered programs focusing on the needs of the people in their community by restoring lives one child and family at a time.

name: Restoration Chapel
description: Restoration Chapel is a ministry of Christ Community Chapel located at the Cuyahoga Hills Youth Detention Center. Weekly service includes worship, a message and time to interact with the young men who attend. 25-75 young men from the facility that houses 160 young men from the age of 12-18 attend weekly. We also hold bible studies, skills classes and participates in the weekly orientation intake process.
